com.radirius.mercury.graphics.wip.gui

Class Component

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.radirius.mercury.graphics.wip.gui.Component
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Updatable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Checkbox, Checkbox.TickBox, Panel, RadioButtonGroup, TextField

    public class Component
extends Object
implements Updatable
    This is the base to a GUI system meant to minimally mimic how HTML works. There are many different settings that all components share. ANY of these can be changed, but to varying effect. Components can store other 'children' components inside of them, like the structure in an XML document would allow for. ActionCheck also allows for functionality to be built into the components, much like javascript in HTML, only more embed. There is one central rendering method that will draw every single component, allowing for extreme flexibility. Unlike swing or other GUI frameworks, this one emulates XML scripting. Therefor, the renderer is dynamic, relying only on the options of the given component.
    Author:
    wessles

        Parameters:

      • processChildren

        protected Vector2f processChildren()
        Processes the children. If g is not null, then it will render them as well. Cutoff width is assumed infinite.
        Returns:
        the width / height that all children/sub-children take up

      • processChildren

        protected Vector2f processChildren(float cutoffWidth)
        Processes the children. If g is not null, then it will render them as well.
        Parameters:
        cutoffWidth - The cutoff width for when there needs to be a new line
        Returns:
        the width / height that all children/sub-children take up

      • processChildren

        protected Vector2f processChildren(Graphics g,
                       float x,
                       float y)
        Processes the children. If g is not null, then it will render them as well. Cutoff width is assumed infinite.
        Parameters:
        g - A graphics object for rendering the children (only will render if not null)
        x - The starting x
        y - The starting y
        Returns:
        the width / height that all children/sub-children take up

      • processChildren

        protected Vector2f processChildren(float cutoffWidth,
                       Graphics g,
                       float x,
                       float y)
        Processes the children. If g is not null, then it will render them as well.
        Parameters:
        cutoffWidth - The cutoff width for when there needs to be a new line
        g - A graphics object for rendering the children (only will render if not null)
        x - The starting x
        y - The starting y
        Returns:
        the width / height that all children/sub-children take up
